item.title: Student Fall ’24/Spring ’25 Parking Permits Available as of August 1
item.description: Student parking permits for the Fall ’24/Spring ’25 semesters will be available for sale beginning Thursday, August 1. Please note that first-year students are not allowed to have a vehicle on campus, and all other students must register and have a valid permit before parking on campus. For additional information, please contact the Parking office by phone at (518) 276-6616 or via email.
item.author: Students

item.title: Finance Announces Helen Grzymala’s Retirement
item.description: Date: Tuesday, August 20, 2024 2:00 PM - 4:00 PM - School’s out forever, and this calls for a party! After more than 29 years of service at Rensselaer, Helen Grzymala will be retiring, and the campus community is welcome to join Finance in honoring her at a reception to be held in the Heffner Alumni House Great Room.
item.author: Community

item.title: Sage Avenue Entrance to Campus Now Open
item.description: Facilities Management in Rensselaer’s Administration Division is pleased to announce that the entrance to the main campus off of Sage Avenue is now open, and thanks the members of the campus community for their patience as this project was being completed.
item.author: Community

item.title: Track & Field Sees 12 Receive USTFCCCA All-Academic Honors
item.description: A dozen student-athletes representing the Rensselaer men’s track & field program have been recognized as All-Academic Athletes for the 2024 NCAA Division III Men’s Track & Field seasons, as announced by the U.S. Track & Field and Cross Country Coaches Association (USTFCCCA).

item.title: MBA for Professionals Review to be Held August 14
item.description: Date: Wednesday, August 14, 2024 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews this innovative project-based, online MBA for professionals program. Participants will learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with real-world MBA experience, prepare to lead the most dynamic and innovative organizations, and engage, involve, motivate, and lead others to reach their fullest potential….

item.title: HelioCampus Syllabus Available for Fall Term
item.description:
The HelioCampus syllabus module is available for faculty to access for the fall term beginning on August 5, 2024. Based on the requirements from the Provost’s office, faculty should have their syllabi published in HelioCampus by September 11, 2024.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
